official-title.#text: To authorize health insurance issuers to continue to offer for sale current individual health insurance coverage in satisfaction of the minimum essential health insurance coverage requirement, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives November 15, 2013.

short-title.#text: Keep Your Health Plan Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: If you like your health care plan, you can keep it

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (including any amendment made by such Act or by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ), a health insurance issuer that has in effect health insurance coverage in the individual market as of January 1, 2013, may continue after such date to offer such coverage for sale during 2014 in such market outside of an Exchange established under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010
Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311
Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1321

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be treated as a grandfathered health plan for purposes of the amendment made by
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Keep Your Health Plan Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 1501(b) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1501/ss:b

header.#text: Treatment as grandfathered health plan in satisfaction of minimum essential coverage

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3350 EH: Keep Your Health Plan Act of 2013
